litematica_printer.config.autoInventory: Remote Interaction - Auto Remote Interaction Setup
Automatically enable remote container interaction feature when allowed by the server, otherwise automatically disable it
litematica_printer.config.bedrock.desc: Invoke BedrockMiner mod to achieve bedrock mining. This feature is unavailable if the mod is not installed.
litematica_printer.config.breakBlocksPer:
Number of blocks that can be broken per game tick. Higher values mean more blocks broken each time (provided the blocks can be broken within one game tick).
Set to §b0§r for no limit, you can try enabling §6§lUse Packet Placement§r to optimize efficiency.
litematica_printer.config.breakCheckHard: Whether to skip unbreakable blocks (blocks with hardness of -1). If only the hardness of certain blocks has been modified on the server side, you can disable this option.
Cooldown time after breaking blocks at the same location (in game ticks). Retry breaking operation only after cooldown ends.
litematica_printer.config.breakUsePacket: Use sending mining packets instead of conventional mining logic, which can theoretically speed up mining efficiency.
litematica_printer.config.breakProgressT:
Progress threshold when mining blocks. Mining is considered complete when this percentage is reached.
Higher values mean lower mining efficiency; lower values mean faster mining efficiency.
Since servers consider mining complete when progress reaches 70%%%%, then wait for end mining packet reception,
you can lower it on servers without additional mining detection.
litematica_printer.config.breakSpeed.des:
Interval time for breaking blocks (in game ticks).
Set to 0 for no interval (may cause server lag), recommended to set to 1-5 to balance speed and performance.
litematica_printer.config.checkPlayerInt:
When enabled, printer only processes blocks within player's block interaction range.
Positions beyond interaction distance will not perform operations to avoid cross-distance operations being detected by servers.
If you're playing on servers that allow cross-distance interaction, you can disable this option.
litematica_printer.config.closeAllMode.d: Close all working modes; if currently running in single mode, will automatically revert to printing mode.
litematica_printer.config.cloudInventory:
In servers supporting remote container interaction or in single-player mode, remote item interaction can be achieved.
Interaction position is the container position preset in the projection.
litematica_printer.config.debugOutput.de:
When enabled, console will output printer debug information.
If §6§lShow Work Status§r is also enabled, some information will also be displayed in the operation interface.
litematica_printer.config.easyPlaceProto:
Use Servex's easy place protocol to handle block placement correction during printing.
§lNote:§r This feature only works in single-player or on servers with Servux installed.
litematica_printer.config.excavateBlackl:
Prohibit mining blocks in this list.
Can input item ID or translated name in current language, example: §bminecraft:stone§r §bsandstone§r.
Prefix §b#§r for tag matching, example: §l#minecraft:logs§r.
Input text and filter conditions simultaneously (separated by English comma), example: §lglazed_terracotta,c§r.
Where "c" represents contains matching, prioritizing pinyin or direct matching.
Block filtering rules for mining mode.
§dNo Limit§r: No restriction on any block mining
§dWhitelist§r: Only allow mining blocks in whitelist
§dBlacklist§r: Prohibit mining blocks in blacklist
§lNote:§r When using Tweakeroo mining limit presets, this setting will not take effect.§r
litematica_printer.config.excavateLimite:
Source of mining limit rules:
§dTweakeroo Preset§r: Use Tweakeroo mod's mining limit rules
§dCustom§r: Use printer's custom mining limit rules.
litematica_printer.config.excavateWhitel:
Only allow mining blocks in this list.
Can input item ID or translated name in current language, example: §bminecraft:stone§r §bsandstone§r.
Prefix §b#§r for tag matching, example: §l#minecraft:logs§r.
Input text and filter conditions simultaneously (separated by English comma), example: §lglazed_terracotta,c§r.
Where "c" represents contains matching, prioritizing pinyin or direct matching.
litematica_printer.config.fill.desc: Within the selection range, place blocks configured in §6Fill Block List§r.
Block list used by filling mode, configuration rules consistent with "Basic Block List".
Block selection mode for filling.
§dBlock List§r: Use blocks in configured list
§dHeld Item§r: Use currently held block in main hand
litematica_printer.config.fillModeFacing: Facing settings when filling blocks. For example, placing upper slabs or lower slabs.
litematica_printer.config.fillSelectionT:
Working selection range rules for filling mode:
§dProjection Selection§r: Use complete selection currently selected in projection as working range
§dProjection Render Layer§r: Only execute filling within current render layer range of projection
§dProjection Selection Below Player§r: Only process areas below player's height in selection
§dProjection Selection Above Player§r: Only process areas above player's height in selection
litematica_printer.config.fluid.desc: At lava sources and water sources positions, default place blocks configured in §6Fluid Replacement Block List§r.
litematica_printer.config.fluidReplaceBl:
Block list for filling liquids. Can input item ID or displayed name, example: §bminecraft:sand§r §bsand§r.
Prefix §b#§r for tag matching, example: §l#minecraft:sand§r.
litematica_printer.config.fluidList.desc: List of liquids that need to be replaced, can only input liquid IDs, example: §bminecraft:water§r.
litematica_printer.config.fluidModeFillF: When enabled, flowing liquids will also be treated as targets needing filling and replacement.
litematica_printer.config.fluidSelection:
Working selection range rules for fluid removal mode:
§dProjection Selection§r: Use complete selection currently selected in projection as working range
§dProjection Render Layer§r: Only execute fluid removal within current render layer range of projection
§dProjection Selection Below Player§r: Only process areas below player's height in selection
§dProjection Selection Above Player§r: Only process areas above player's height in selection
litematica_printer.config.printForcedSne: Automatically maintain sneaking state during printing process.
Container whitelist that printer can recognize and use. Only containers in whitelist will be invoked by printer.
litematica_printer.config.mine.desc: Mine all non-liquid blocks within selection range.
litematica_printer.config.mineSelectionT:
Working selection range rules for mining mode:
§dProjection Selection§r: Use complete selection currently selected in projection as working range
§dProjection Render Layer§r: Only execute mining within current render layer range of projection
§dProjection Selection Below Player§r: Only process areas below player's height in selection
§dProjection Selection Above Player§r: Only process areas above player's height in selection (default)
litematica_printer.config.modeSwitch.des:
§dSingle Mode§r: Only run one working mode at a time
§dMulti Mode§r: Can run multiple working modes simultaneously
§lNote:§r Need to reopen settings menu after switching to see mode change effects.§r
litematica_printer.config.multiBreak.des: When enabled, execute operations according to mode priority. Low priority modes will pause when high priority modes are running.
litematica_printer.config.openScreen.des: Hotkey to open printer settings menu (the page you're currently viewing).
litematica_printer.config.placeBlocksPer:
Number of blocks that can be placed per game tick. Higher values mean more blocks placed each time.
Set to §b0§r for no limit. On servers with packet restrictions, you can try enabling §6§lUse Packet Placement§r to optimize efficiency.
Cooldown time after placing blocks at the same location (in game ticks). Retry placement operation only after cooldown ends.
§c§lDo not set to 0 unless necessary, otherwise it will cause placing extra blocks, inability to place correctly and other issues!§r
litematica_printer.config.placeSpeed.des:
Interval time for placing blocks (in game ticks).
May automatically add delays to avoid placement errors for some special blocks.
Setting to 0 may cause poor performance on servers with packet restrictions.
Not recommended to set to 0 when printing redstone mechanisms.
litematica_printer.config.printBreakWron: Automatically break blocks that completely mismatch the schematic during printing.
litematica_printer.config.printHotkey.de: When holding the bound hotkey, printer will continuously place blocks.
litematica_printer.config.placeInAir.des: Ignore block support requirements and place blocks directly in air positions (applicable to unsupported decorative blocks).
litematica_printer.config.printMode.repl:
In replacement mode, replace specified source blocks with target blocks in selection area.
Can input source block ID/name and target block ID/name (separated by English colon), example: §bminecraft:stone:minecraft:oak_planks§r §bstone:oak_planks§r.
Prefix §b#§r for tag matching, example: §l#logs:minecraft:oak_planks§r (replace all logs with oak planks).
litematica_printer.config.printSelection:
Working selection range rules for printing mode:
§dProjection Selection§r: Use complete selection currently selected in projection as working range
§dProjection Render Layer§r: Only execute printing within current render layer range of projection
§dProjection Selection Below Player§r: Only process areas below player's height in selection
§dProjection Selection Above Player§r: Only process areas above player's height in selection (default)
litematica_printer.config.printIceForWat: Generate water source blocks through "place ice → break ice" method to achieve water source printing.
litematica_printer.config.printerAutoDis: Automatically disable printer when player dies to avoid misoperations after respawning.
litematica_printer.config.printAutoFillC:
Automatically fill compostable items into composters to generate bone meal.
(§lWarning: This operation will consume compostable items in inventory!§r)

Compostable items used for automatic composter filling.
Can input item ID or translated name in current language, example: §bminecraft:wheat§r §bwheat§r.
Prefix §b#§r for tag matching, example: §l#compostable§r.
Add ",c" after text for contains matching (prioritizing pinyin/direct matching), example: §lwheat,c§r.
litematica_printer.config.printAutoStrip: When enabled, if stripped logs are not in inventory, will first place normal logs, then automatically strip them with axe to save manual operation time.
litematica_printer.config.printAutoTunin: When printing note blocks, automatically tune note blocks to the pitch specified in schematic.
litematica_printer.config.printBreakExtr: Automatically break extra blocks that don't exist in schematic during printing.
litematica_printer.config.printBreakWron:
Automatically break blocks whose type matches schematic but state doesn't, and need to be broken for adjustment during printing.
Examples: stairs/slabs with wrong orientation, vines with extra faces, etc.; blocks that can be corrected by clicking (like trapdoors, campfires) won't be broken.
litematica_printer.config.printFallingBl: When enabled, will check if blocks below falling blocks match schematic, and skip placement if incorrect.
litematica_printer.config.printerInvento:
If remote item retrieval target is in unloaded chunks, retrieval time will increase; after selecting projection selection, press hotkey to bind printer inventory.
Printer will prioritize using items from this inventory when working; recommend placing dummy entities in inventory area to keep chunks loaded.
litematica_printer.config.printerIterato:
Block iteration order during printing:
§dXYZ§r: X axis first, then Y axis, finally Z axis
§dXZY§r: X axis first, then Z axis, finally Y axis
§dYXZ§r: Y axis first, then X axis, finally Z axis
§dYZX§r: Y axis first, then Z axis, finally X axis
§dZXY§r: Z axis first, then X axis, finally Y axis
§dZYX§r: Z axis first, then Y axis, finally X axis

Area shape for printer block iteration:
§dCube§r: Cube with §6§lWork Radius§r as edge length (recommended value: 3)
§dSphere§r: Sphere with §6§lWork Radius§r as radius (recommended value: 6)
§dOctahedron§r: Octahedron with §6§lWork Radius§r as edge length (recommended value: 6)

Maximum time allocated to printer block iteration per cycle during work (milliseconds), set to 0 for no limit.
Usually no need to modify this. If experiencing lag, try lowering this value; if wanting to improve efficiency in large areas, try increasing this value.
litematica_printer.config.printerLagChec:
Detect packet reception lag when printer is working; if no new packets received for over 20 game ticks,
will automatically pause work until packet reception resumes.
litematica_printer.config.printerMode.de:
Printer's core work mode:
§dPrinting§r: Restore blocks in projection blueprint (including direction, state and other properties)
§dMining§r: Mine blocks within selection range (except fluids)
§dBedrock Breaking§r: Break bedrock within selection range using game mechanics (only available for 1.19+ with Bedrock Miner mod installed)
§dFluid Removal§r: Fill liquids in projection selection with specified blocks
§dFilling§r: Fill projection selection with blocks

§lNote:§r Except for §dPrinting§r mode, operation ranges of other modes are all within projection selection, can also be changed by adjusting §6§lSelection Type§r of each mode.
litematica_printer.config.quickShulker.d: Directly take needed materials from shulker boxes in inventory for quick item retrieval.
litematica_printer.config.quickShulkerCo: Cooldown time for quick shulker function (in game ticks). Some plugin servers have cooldown restrictions for this function. Set to 0 to disable cooldown.
litematica_printer.config.quickShulkerMo:
§dSimulate Click§r: Right-click shulker box slot in inventory to open (requires server plugin support)
§dInvoke Mod§r: Directly invoke QuickShulker mod to open (requires installation on both sides for normal use)
litematica_printer.config.printerRange.d:
Printer's maximum work radius centered on player (blocks). Larger values mean wider coverage.
This parameter is associated with §6§lIteration Area Shape§r.
litematica_printer.config.printSafelyObs: Check if suitable for placement before placing observers to avoid accidentally triggering your machines and causing disasters.
litematica_printer.config.printerSelecti:
Working selection range rules for printing mode:
§dProjection Selection§r: Use complete selection currently selected in projection as working range
§dProjection Render Layer§r: Only execute printing within current render layer range of projection
§dProjection Selection Below Player§r: Only process areas below player's height in selection
§dProjection Selection Above Player§r: Only process areas above player's height in selection
litematica_printer.config.placeUsePacket:
Use sending placement packets instead of conventional placement logic to reduce "ghost block" phenomenon.
Can try enabling this in environments with packet restrictions.
litematica_printer.config.printerWorking:
Number of block operations executed per game tick (only effective when print interval is set to 0).
Recommended to set to 2-8 to balance speed and performance. Too high values may get kicked by server.
litematica_printer.config.printerXAxisRe: When enabled, X axis iteration order changes to largest to smallest.
litematica_printer.config.printerYAxisRe: When enabled, Y axis iteration order changes to largest to smallest.
litematica_printer.config.printerZAxisRe: When enabled, Z axis iteration order changes to largest to smallest.
litematica_printer.config.printSkip.desc: When enabled, will skip blocks in the list during printing.
Block list skipped during printing. Can input item ID or translated name in current language, example: §bminecraft:stone§r §bsandstone§r.
Prefix §b#§r for tag matching, example: §l#minecraft:logs§r.
Add ",c" after text for contains matching, example: §lglazed_terracotta,c§r.
litematica_printer.config.removePrintInv: Clear the bound printer inventory list.
litematica_printer.config.renderHud.desc:
Display current mode and work progress within range on operation page when printer is working;
If §6§lLag Detection§r is enabled, will show prompt when lag is excessive.
litematica_printer.config.renderLayerLim: Limit printer work range to Litematica's currently rendered layer range.
litematica_printer.config.printReplace.d: Directly overwrite blocks in list without skipping processing or breaking.
litematica_printer.config.printReplaceCo: When printing dead coral, if no dead coral in inventory, use live coral as substitute; if both exist, will prioritize using dead coral.
litematica_printer.config.printReplaceab:
Block list that can be directly overwritten during printing (without breaking original blocks).
Can input item ID or translated name in current language, example: §bminecraft:stone§r §bsandstone§r.
Prefix §b#§r for tag matching, example: §l#minecraft:logs§r.
Add ",c" after text for contains matching, example: §lglazed_terracotta,c§r.
litematica_printer.config.switchPrinterM: Switch printer's current work mode (printing/mining/bedrock breaking, etc.).
After pressing hotkey, record currently targeted container, and sync items from same type containers within projection selection to this container.
litematica_printer.config.syncInventoryC:
Toggle for container synchronization function.
(I don't know why this option is categorized here)
Highlight color for container synchronization and printer inventory blocks; set to §l#00000000§r to disable highlighting.
litematica_printer.config.updateCheck.de: Automatically check for mod updates when first entering world.
litematica_printer.free_notice: This mod's translate is not completed, HELP US PLEASE
litematica_printer.update.available: Litematica Printer detected new version! Current version: %s, latest version: %s
litematica_printer.update.download: >> Click here to download latest version <<
litematica_printer.update.failed: Update check failed, please try again later.
litematica_printer.update.recommendation: Strongly recommend upgrading to latest version to fix potential serious issues.
